Bolsonaro: "Argentina precisa de Brasil y nosotros de la Argentina"

03 Nov 2019, 08:29

El presidente brasileño, Jair Bolsonaro, moderó hoy su discurso frente al futuro gobierno de Alberto Fernández al señalar que "la Argentina precisa de Brasil y Brasil precisa de la Argentina", al tiempo que dejó abierta la posibilidad de enviar a un representante a la ceremonia de asunción del líder del Frente de Todos.  El leve giro en el discurso del jefe de Estado de Brasil se dio un día después de que el presidente de Estados Unidos, Donald Trump, llamara por teléfono a Fernández para felicitarlo por su victoria electoral y manifestarle su apoyo para que la Argentina "logre superar los desafíos económicos".  "La Argentina precisa de Brasil y Brasil precisa de la Argentina", manifestó Bolsonaro tras las fuertes críticas que había dedicado a Fernández y que llegaron incluso al plano personal cuando el diputado Eduardo Bolsonaro, hijo del mandatario, se burló de Estanislao Fernández, el hijo del presidente electo.  Si bien el presidente del vecino país mantuvo en parte su tono duro al reiterar con que "no" piensa "llamarlo" a Fernández "para desearle suerte, ni tampoco ir a la asunción del mando", hizo un guiño a la posibilidad de enviar a un representante de Brasil al acto institucional del 10 de diciembre.  En este sentido, indicó: "Si alguien del gobierno quiere ir, basta que me hable. Si hubiera algún voluntario, está libre para ir".  Bolsonaro había expresado su apoyo a la reelección del presidente Mauricio Macri y luego de la derrota del mandatario en las urnas se animó a declarar que "la Argentina eligió mal", a lo que le siguieron más críticas y la burla de su hijo.  Tras esas manifestaciones, el canciller Jorge Faurie no quiso cursar una queja formal a su par brasileño para evitar una escalada peor, pero sí envió una carta de protesta al embajador de Brasil en la Argentina, Sergio Danese.  El evidente enojo de Bolsonaro con el resultado de las elecciones nacionales no solo se dio por las diferencias ideológicas que lo separan de Fernández sino también por el reclamo público del presidente electo por la libertad del ex mandatario brasileño Luiz Inacio "Lula" Da Silva.  La nueva postura, más moderada, de Bolsonaro frente a la Argentina se enmarca no solo en el contacto que Estados Unidos tomó con el futuro Gobierno sino también en la preocupación que la escalada verbal generó en empresarios de ambos países por el destino del comercio en el ámbito del Mercosur.

Bolsonaro: "Argentina needs Brazil and we from Argentina"

03 Nov 2019, 08:29

The Brazilian president, Jair Bolsonaro, moderated his speech today against the future government of Alberto Fernández by pointing out that "Argentina needs Brazil and Brazil needs Argentina", while leaving open the possibility of sending a representative to the ceremony of assumption of the leader of the Front of All. The slight turn in the speech of the head of State of Brazil took place one day after the president of the United States, Donald Trump, called Fernández on the phone to congratulate him on his electoral victory and express his support for Argentina "to overcome the economic challenges. " "Argentina needs Brazil and Brazil needs Argentina," Bolsonaro said after the strong criticism he had dedicated to Fernández and that they even reached the personal level when Deputy Eduardo Bolsonaro, son of the president, made fun of Estanislao Fernández, the son of the elected president. While the president of the neighboring country partly maintained his harsh tone by reiterating that "he" does not "call" Fernandez "to wish him luck, nor go to the assumption of command," he winked at the possibility of sending a representative from Brazil to the institutional act of December 10. In this regard, he said: "If someone from the government wants to go, just talk to me. If there were any volunteers, they are free to go." Bolsonaro had expressed his support for the re-election of President Mauricio Macri and after the defeat of the president at the polls he was encouraged to declare that "Argentina chose badly", followed by more criticism and mockery of his son. After these demonstrations, Foreign Minister Jorge Faurie did not want to file a formal complaint with his Brazilian counterpart to avoid a worse escalation, but he did send a letter of protest to the Brazilian ambassador to Argentina, Sergio Danese. The obvious anger of Bolsonaro with the result of the national elections was not only due to the ideological differences that separate him from Fernández but also to the public claim of the president-elect for the freedom of former Brazilian president Luiz Inacio "Lula" Da Silva. The new position, more moderate, of Bolsonaro against Argentina is framed not only in the contact that the United States took with the future Government but also in the concern that verbal escalation generated in businessmen of both countries for the fate of trade in the scope of Mercosur.
